title: Don't suppose any Rioter can speak out about the whole Morde/Sona/Cass identity fiasco?
body: This place has less red then a Noir film

People who say Cass is fine never even play her, they don't even know what her passive gives her, they know nothing, it's just that once in a while they get to fight a Cassio main who does well. But truly Cassio is outclassed by other mages and is extremely frustating to play as in the early and mid game, her bases are too low, too team dependent compared to other mages and her mechanics get really boring after you play her a couple of times. Her W is laughable, it does no damage and it is only used to slow for a bit (25% slow rank 1) to hit a Q and start spamming E, that's it. Once you get a Rylais her W is technically useless since your Es and Q will slow targets better. Her damage is really poor if you compare her to her mana pool, she can drain her mana really quickly without dealing that much damage early game, if for example Viktor or even Anivia drain their manapool to deal damage to a target, the damage dealt would be higher than Cass's, I'm talking in the early game... Late game she is fine, kind of broken even, two E's and the squishy is dead, I don't like her pattern as it is right now. I think Cass should be a poison/control mage, not a machine gun.

Cass is a hyper carry. She also is a bit of a lane bully. The mana refresh on her e also means she really has an easy time charging up. You think she should be a poison mage I think she already is. I think Cass has had her identity more solidified. You saying that Anivia can do more damage by draining her mana pool is really silly. If she drains her mana pool with her r she does like no damage. Her best combo is R->E

I've played a lot of Cassiopeia since her release and I was pretty disappointed with her rework. I'm not sure Cassiopeia has an identity crisis, they just changed her in a way that is generally unsuitable to gameplay. 

They took a champion that is squishy and has no mobility and made her a short-range mage; that in itself is a recipe for disaster. I think the major issue is that so much of her damage is frontloaded onto her (E) Twin Fangs that it makes her others spells just an accessory to enable you to spam out more Twin Fangs which is a pretty bad feeling. 

Her new passive is also pretty bad, it definitely has the feast or famine feel to it. If you're doing extremely well or extremely poorly in lane chances are you won't be getting as many stacks as if you were trading evenly. If you are completely shutting down the opponent, they're probably hiding under tower and you won't be able to poison them for more stacks. On the other hand if you're getting completely shit on, you won't be able to get many stacks either. I just don't really like a champion that has a ramp up time of at least 30+ minutes. It's almost impossible to get to 500 stacks before the 30 minute mark regardless of how well you're doing which is a pretty shitty feeling. Besides that, with the nerfs to her mana cost, it requires her to build a mana item, so you're pretty restricted to RoA or Tear, which in a lot of cases is fine, but it does limit her gameplay.

I just want them to reward you for winning lane; if I'm crushing someone in lane, I should be ramping up with Aspect of the Serpent stacks much more quickly. Furthermore, she shouldn't have lost her identity of a high range mage, she needs to be able to use her (Q) Noxious Blast for meaningful poke and harass, not just an accessory for her to use Twin Fang
They're too arrogant for that
